result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)] and Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Dustin C Geissler was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber privileges subject to jail policies.  Good time Allowed.
Comply with treatment.  Count 2 and 3 dismissed. Refusal dismissed.

miscConds.notes: Fine $1588 less $500 cash bond posted.  Balance to probation.
Not to go upon premises for on site consumption/possession of alcohol.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Must Comply with all requirements of OWI Treatment Court.

timeConds.notes: Huber privileges subject to jail policies.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for Exemption - faxed to MVD; cc to defendant.
for Exemption filed by defendant.
Order for Referral to OWI Treatment Court.

ADA Chris Genda appeared on behalf of State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appeared in person with Atty William Ginsberg.  14CF80 called also.  Amended Information filed in 14CF80. Rights/elements. In 14CF80, no contest plea to Ct 2, 3, 4.  Ct 1 dismissed.  Court adjudged guilty, JOC entered.  Cts 2, 3 and 4- 30 days jail each concurrent to each other.  1 day jail credit.  Costs Ct 2, $443.00 due 60 days. Ct 3 and 4, $243.00 costs due 60 days. DNA sample to be given.     In 16CF17, Ct 1, OWI 4th guilty, adjudged guilty, JOC entered. Ct 2 dismissed.   To undergo  OWI treatment program.  Sentence imposed and stayed,  placed on 2 years probation, 9 months jail stayed with good time if revoked, Conditions:  50 days jail with huber commencing  10-13-16 commerce forthwith consecutive to 16CF17.  Fine 1788.00 to probation, 30 month revocation, 30 month IID, AODA.   of Maintain absolute sobriety.  Not go upon premises for on site consumption of alcohol.  Must comply with all requirements of Treatment Court.  Victim rights complied with.  Refusal dismissed.  No jail credit.
plea and sentence on October 13 at 1:00 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 19, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Atty. Ginsberg requests this case be added to Sept. 19 plea in defendant's 14CF80 case

Cases called: 14CF80, 16CF17, Defendant Dustin C Geissler in court with attorney William Ginsberg.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Resolution agreed upon. Request for argued separate plea/sentencing date. Parties to ask Br. 3
Return Date 7/20/2016 2:45pm Branch 1
Letter from Atty Ginsberg requesting a reset of the 7-7-16 return date to 7-20-16 - time for negotiations in 16 CF 17 and 14 CF 80 - fax

Defendant Dustin C Geissler in court with attorney William Ginsberg.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Atty. Ginsberg entered a not guilty plea.  Return date scheduled for July 7, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Count 3 added-PAC 4th.
from Atty. Ginsberg stating he represents defendant
standard felony conditions, absolute sobriety, not possess/consume alcohol, not go upon premises where alcohol is sold for onsight consumption

Defendant Dustin C Geissler in court, in custody by video with attorney Tristan F Eagon.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. waives reading of complaint, right to atty recited, $500.00 cash bond, standard felony conditions, absolute sobriety, not possess/consume alcohol, not go upon premises where alcohol is sold for onsight consumption, waives time limits to prelim,  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Return date scheduled for March 22, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
